gov.sandia.cognition.graph.inference

Class SumProductInferencingAlgorithm<LabelType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.sandia.cognition.graph.inference.SumProductInferencingAlgorithm<LabelType>
  • Type Parameters:
    LabelType - The type for labels
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    EnergyFunctionSolver<LabelType>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SumProductBeliefPropagation, SumProductDirectedPropagation

    @PublicationReference(author="Jonahtan S. Yedidia, William T. Freeman, and Yair Weiss",
                      title="Understanding Belief Propagation and its Generalizations",
                      type=TechnicalReport,
                      year=2001,
                      notes="Institution: Mitsubishi Electric Research Laboratories")
public abstract class SumProductInferencingAlgorithm<LabelType>
extends java.lang.Object
implements EnergyFunctionSolver<LabelType>
    Base class for Sum-Product inferencing algorithms on graphs/energy functions
    Author:
    jdwendt, tong

    • Method Detail

      • solve

        public boolean solve()
        Description copied from interface: EnergyFunctionSolver
        Solves for the energy function passed in during initialize, e.g., compute the beliefs.
        Specified by:
        solve in interface EnergyFunctionSolver<LabelType>
        Returns:
        true if converged, false otherwise.

      • computeTemporaryMessage

        protected abstract void computeTemporaryMessage(int edge)
        Private helper that computes the temporary message for the specified edge for the current iteration going in the specified direction (a different message for each direction)
        Parameters:
        edge - The edge to compute the temporary message for (you can't replace the current message yet as the current message may be needed for other edges).

      • init

        public void init(EnergyFunction<LabelType> f)
        Description copied from interface: EnergyFunctionSolver
        Initializes internal state and stores the energy function for future solutions. The energy function can still change its unary and pairwise method outputs after this is called, but the number of nodes, edges, etc. must stay constant.
        Specified by:
        init in interface EnergyFunctionSolver<LabelType>
        Parameters:
        f - The energy function to initialize against

      • getBelief

        public double getBelief(int i,
                        int label)
        Description copied from interface: EnergyFunctionSolver
        Gets the belief for node i with the specified label. This can only be called after solve().
        Specified by:
        getBelief in interface EnergyFunctionSolver<LabelType>
        Parameters:
        i - The index of the node whose belief associated with the input label is wanted
        label - The label for the node whose belief is desired
        Returns:
        The belief for the input node/label pair
